prompt: Write a regex pattern to match 4-digit years (1900-2099). Test cases: "2024" (should match), "1999" (should match), "999" (should NOT match), "2100" (should NOT match). Respond with only the regex pattern, no delimiters or explanation.

Write a regex pattern to match words ending with 'ing'. Test cases: "running" (should match), "testing" (should match), "run" (should NOT match), "sing" (should match). Respond with only the regex pattern, no delimiters or explanation.

Write a regex pattern to match 5-letter words. Test cases: "hello" (should match), "world" (should match), "hi" (should NOT match), "testing" (should NOT match). Respond with only the regex pattern, no delimiters or explanation.

Write a regex pattern to match GitHub usernames (alphanumeric and hyphens, cannot start/end with hyphen). Test cases: "john-doe" (should match), "user123" (should match), "-invalid" (should NOT match), "user-" (should NOT match). Respond with only the regex pattern, no delimiters or explanation.

Write a regex pattern to match time in HH:MM format (24-hour). Test cases: "14:30" (should match), "09:05" (should match), "25:00" (should NOT match), "9:30" (should NOT match). Respond with only the regex pattern, no delimiters or explanation.

Write a regex pattern to match Python import statements. Test cases: "import os" (should match), "from sys import argv" (should match), "include numpy" (should NOT match), "import" (should NOT match). Respond with only the regex pattern, no delimiters or explanation.

Write a regex pattern to match CSS class selectors. Test cases: ".button" (should match), ".nav-item" (should match), "button" (should NOT match), "#id" (should NOT match). Respond with only the regex pattern, no delimiters or explanation.

Write a regex pattern to match semantic version numbers (e.g., 1.2.3). Test cases: "1.0.0" (should match), "12.34.56" (should match), "1.2" (should NOT match), "1.2.3.4" (should NOT match). Respond with only the regex pattern, no delimiters or explanation.

Write a regex pattern to match credit card numbers (4 groups of 4 digits, spaces or hyphens as separators). Test cases: "1234 5678 9012 3456" (should match), "1234-5678-9012-3456" (should match), "1234567890123456" (should NOT match), "1234 5678 9012" (should NOT match). Respond with only the regex pattern, no delimiters or explanation.

Write a regex pattern to match valid Python variable assignments (name = value). Test cases: "x = 5" (should match), "result_123 = True" (should match), "123var = 1" (should NOT match), "x=" (should NOT match). Respond with only the regex pattern, no delimiters or explanation.

Write a regex pattern to match MAC addresses (6 groups of 2 hex digits, colon or hyphen separated). Test cases: "AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF" (should match), "00-11-22-33-44-55" (should match), "ZZ:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF" (should NOT match), "AA:BB:CC:DD:EE" (should NOT match). Respond with only the regex pattern, no delimiters or explanation.
